enrichments.extra_info: As of January 1, 2025, Bulgaria and Romania joined the Schengen Area fully. The 90/180 rule is a rolling window - it checks 180 days backwards from any given moment. Simply crossing to non-Schengen countries (UK, Ireland, Switzerland) every 3 months does NOT reset the count. Digital nomad visas available in some countries (Spain, Portugal, Estonia) allow longer stays. Overstaying can result in entry bans (1-5 years), fines (€500-€1000+), and deportation. From October 12, 2025, the new Entry/Exit System (EES) will automatically track all entries/exits with biometric data.

enrichments.extra_info: This method uses a German law created for facilitating government communication with migrants. A German citizen with a German address agrees to receive mail on your behalf by filling out an online form and attaching their ID copy. The vehicle is registered in YOUR name (not proxy), using the German address for mail receipt only. No lawyer needed. TÜV (vehicle inspection) required every 2 years for vehicles up to 3.5 tons. NEW REQUIREMENT 2025: Gas system inspection (DVGW G 607) now mandatory every 2 years for LPG motorhomes (€40-80, takes 20-45 minutes). Process pioneered by Tom Lerner from the community. Insurance can be obtained from ADAC or other German insurers. Completely legal method recognized by German authorities.

Germany's method more straightforward for non-residents.

Map showing CPD-required countries (Africa, Asia, Middle East)
enrichments.extra_info: The CPD is managed by FIA (Federation Internationale de l'Automobile) and mandated by World Customs Organization. Standard validity: 1 year from issuance. For multi-year travel: Exit country with carnet exit stamp, close expiring carnet with customs stamp, immediately obtain new carnet for another year. Process can be repeated for continuous multi-year coverage. Electronic e-CPD introduced May 2021 for digital issuance. Document has 5-25 pages with detachable import/export vouchers. Required in many African and Asian countries. NOT required in Europe for private vehicles. Turkish borders accept CPD but also offer local alternative documents. CPD must be issued in country of vehicle registration. Important for motorhome research projects and extended African travel.

enrichments.extra_info: For South Africa entry: Carnet de Passage (ATA Carnet) is the simplest solution for foreign-registered vehicles. Alternative of local registration is very complex, time-consuming, and may be impossible for left-hand drive vehicles (SA requires right-hand drive). CPD can be obtained outside home country (e.g., in France despite different registration). Entry by sea requires additional bureaucracy - highly recommend using local port agent to handle paperwork. Overland entry with CPD is straightforward at borders. Port entry involves complex procedures and customs documentation. Left-hand drive vehicles may face restrictions or prohibition for local registration. Border agents can handle all documentation efficiently with proper CPD.

Strategy: Register under local contact in Germany (best option) or France for better rates.

enrichments.extra_info: Annual testing: Germany and France require inspection every 2 years for vehicles up to 3.5 tons, annually for vehicles over 3.5 tons. NEW 2025: Gas system test (DVGW G 607) mandatory every 2 years for LPG motorhomes (€40-80). SMART STRATEGY for extended travel: Register in Germany or France, then leave country - testing NOT required until re-entry. Real example: 5+ years travel outside Europe with German registration, no testing during entire period. ZOLL/TRANSIT number (temporary export): Requires customs documentation, import process on return, potentially triggers taxes - NOT recommended for regular European return. Better option: German/French registration allows 7+ years European travel without testing while abroad. Insurance (e.g., AXA Schengen) auto-renews annually even when vehicle outside Europe. Only requirement: Testing when re-entering registration country.

references.name: EU Council - How the Entry/Exit System Works

references.name: EU Migration and Home Affairs - Entry/Exit System
references.description: Official EU information on EES system details

references.name: Wandering Bird - EES Video Explanation
references.description: Motorhome vlogger Cat's explanation of EES impact on travelers

enrichments.extra_info: MAJOR CHANGE starting October 12, 2025: Entry/Exit System (EES) replaces passport stamps with biometric data (fingerprints + facial scan). Applies to ALL non-EU nationals including Israelis and Americans. EVERY person in motorhome must go through biometric process at first entry (including children). System automatically tracks 90/180-day limit - no more manual counting. Border crossings (tunnels, ferries) will take significantly longer, especially in early months. Countries NOT covered: Ireland, Cyprus, UK. Data retained: 3 years (compliant travelers) or 5 years (overstayers). System expected fully operational by April 10, 2026. Progressive rollout across 29 European countries over 6-month period. Children under 12 exempt from fingerprints but need facial scan. Prepare for longer wait times at borders and ensure all passengers have valid passports.

Ferry Tangier crossing: 50 minutes, very straightforward. IMPORTANT: German co-signer must be trustworthy (receives your mail).
